original_reasoning:
Okay, let's see what the user is asking here. They provided a Python code snippet with a missing part that I need to fill in. The code is related to time series analysis using ARIMA and SARIMAX models. The specific TODO is in the ARIMA model diagnostics plot section.

Looking at the code, after fitting the ARIMA model, they create a figure with two subplots. The first subplot (211) plots the predictions from the ARIMA model. The second subplot (212) calls plot_diagnostics() on the ARIMA results. The user's task is to complete this part.

Wait, the plt.tight_layout() and plt.show() are already there after the TODO. But what's missing in the diagnostics plot? The plot_diagnostics() function generates four plots: standardized residuals, histogram plus estimated density, normal Q-Q plot, and correlogram. But maybe they want to set a title for the diagnostics subplot. The first subplot has a title 'ARIMA Model Predictions', but the second subplot (diagnostics) might need a title like 'ARIMA Diagnostics'. 

Looking at the existing code: the second subplot is created with plt.subplot(212), then arima_results.plot_diagnostics(). But the title for the second subplot isn't set. The first subplot has plt.title(...), so the missing line is adding a title to the second subplot. So the missing code should be adding plt.title('ARIMA Diagnostics') after plotting the diagnostics. That makes sense because it labels the diagnostics plot properly.

Alternatively, maybe the user forgot to add a title for the diagnostics plot. Let me check the original code again. The first subplot has a title, then the second subplot is plotted with arima_results.plot_diagnostics(), but no title is set. So the missing line is plt.title('ARIMA Diagnostics') in the second subplot. That would complete the figure by adding a title to the diagnostics part.

So the correct code to add is plt.title('ARIMA Diagnostics') right after the arima_results.plot_diagnostics() line. That way, each subplot has its own title, making the figure more informative.
